+class PackageCreateView(APIView):
+    parser_classes = [MultiPartParser, FormParser]  # To handle file uploads
+
+    def post(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
+        serializer = PackageSerializer(data=request.data)
+        
+        if serializer.is_valid():
+            # Save the package instance
+            package = serializer.save()
+
+            # Add services to the package (ManyToMany field)
+            service_ids = request.data.getlist('services[]')
+            services = Service.objects.filter(id__in=service_ids)
+            package.services.set(services)
+
+            return Response(serializer.data, status=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
+        return Response(serializer.errors, status=status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST)
+    
+
+    def get(self,request,format=None):
+        planners = PlannerList.objects.all()
+        serializer=PlannerListSerializer(planners,many=True)
+        return Response(serializer.data)

+class loginView(APIView):
+    def post(self, request):
+        username = request.data.get('username')
+        password = request.data.get('password')
+        user = authenticate(username=username, password=password)
+
+        if user is not None:
+            profile = user.profile  # Assuming you have a one-to-one relationship between User and Profile
+            if profile.is_approved.lower() == 'true':
+                auth_login(request, user)
+                return Response({"message": "Login successful"}, status=status.HTTP_200_OK)
+            else:
+                return Response({"message": "Your account is not approved yet."}, status=status.HTTP_403_FORBIDDEN)
+        else:
+            return Response({"message": "Invalid credentials"}, status=status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST)

+class PlannerListView(APIView):
+    """
+    View to list all planners, including venues, services, and packages.
+    """
+    def get(self, request, format=None):
+        # Filter planner list based on logged-in user or session ID
+        user = request.user if request.user.is_authenticated else None
+        session_id = request.GET.get("session_id")
+
+        if user:
+            planners = PlannerList.objects.filter(user=user)
+        elif session_id:
+            planners = PlannerList.objects.filter(session_id=session_id)
+        else:
+            planners = PlannerList.objects.none()
+
+        # Serialize planner list
+        serializer = PlannerListSerializer(planners, many=True)
+        return Response(serializer.data)

+    from rest_framework.permissions import IsAuthenticated
+from rest_framework.response import Response
+from rest_framework.views import APIView
+from .models import Venue, Service, Package, PlannerList
+from django.contrib.auth.models import User
+
+class AddToPlannerView(APIView):
+    permission_classes = [IsAuthenticated]  # Ensure only authenticated users can add to planner
+
+    def post(self, request):
+        item_type = request.data.get("item_type")
+        item_id = request.data.get("item_id")
+        
+        # Validate item_type and item_id
+        if not item_type or not item_id:
+            return Response({"message": "Item type and item ID are required"}, status=400)
+
+        # Fetch the item based on item_type
+        if item_type == "venue":
+            item = Venue.objects.get(id=item_id)
+        elif item_type == "service":
+            item = Service.objects.get(id=item_id)
+        elif item_type == "package":
+            item = Package.objects.get(id=item_id)
+        else:
+            return Response({"message": "Invalid item type"}, status=400)
+
+        # Add the item to the planner
+        planner_item = PlannerList(
+            user=request.user,  # The authenticated user
+            session_id=request.session.session_key,  # For anonymous users, if any
+        )
+        
+        if item_type == "venue":
+            planner_item.venue = item
+        elif item_type == "service":
+            planner_item.service = item
+        elif item_type == "package":
+            planner_item.package = item
+        
+        planner_item.save()
+
+        return Response({"message": "Item added to planner successfully"})

+from rest_framework.response import Response
+from rest_framework import status
+
+class AddToPlannerView(APIView):
+    """
+    View to list and create planners, including venues, services, and packages.
+    """
+
+    def get(self, request, format=None):
+        # Filter planner list based on logged-in user or session ID
+        user = request.user if request.user.is_authenticated else None
+        session_id = request.GET.get("session_id")
+
+        if user:
+            planners = PlannerList.objects.filter(user=user)
+        elif session_id:
+            planners = PlannerList.objects.filter(session_id=session_id)
+        else:
+            return Response(
+                {"error": "User not authenticated or session ID missing."},
+                status=status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST,
+            )
+
+        serializer = PlannerListSerializer(planners, many=True)
+        return Response(serializer.data, status=status.HTTP_200_OK)
+
+    def post(self, request, format=None):
+        # Check if the user is authenticated or session ID is provided
+        user = request.user if request.user.is_authenticated else None
+        session_id = request.data.get("session_id")  # Session ID should be passed in request data
+
+        # Deserialize the data
+        serializer = PlannerListSerializer(data=request.data)
+
+        if serializer.is_valid():
+            # Assign user or session_id based on the authentication status
+            serializer.save(user=user, session_id=session_id if not user else None)
+
+            return Response(
+                {"message": "Planner item added successfully.", "data": serializer.data},
+                status=status.HTTP_201_CREATED,
+            )
+        else:
+            return Response(serializer.errors, status=status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST)
